entry.title: [base] Defer posting tasks inside WorkTracker::WaitNoSyncWork
entry.content:
This annotation defers posting tasks inside WorkTracker::WaitNoSyncWork.



It has been observed that inside WorkTracker::WaitNoSyncWork tracing can

happen, which can cause a PostTask, which can cause two `CheckedLock`s to

be acquired that are not annotated to be acquired in the same callstack.



This is roughly how the problem can happen:

* WorkTracker::WaitNoSyncWork acquires the CheckedLock

`active_sync_work_lock_`

* WorkTracer::WaitNoSyncWork calls `active_sync_work_cv_->Wait();`

* Tracing can happen (in multiple places). For example in the

constructor and destructor of

`base::ScopedBlockingCallWithBaseSyncPrimitives`

* Inside perfetto, based on how full the shared memory buffer chunks

are, it's possible that a PostTask happens.

* Inside PostTask, `TaskQueueImpl::GetTaskDelayAdjustment` can try to

acquire the CheckedLock `any_thread_lock_`



`TaskQueueImpl::any_thread_lock_` and

`WorkTracker::active_sync_work_lock_` are two checked locks that are not

annotated to be acquireable in the same callstack, so a DCHECK will be

hit.



Bug: 1515901

Change-Id: Id20e18dcf8f57113648503d9d80f097ffe5b4655

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5177389

Commit-Queue: Daniele Di Proietto

Reviewed-by: Etienne Pierre-Doray

Reviewed-by: Eric Seckler

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1245379}

entry.title: Revert "[Waffle] Support for high DPI icons"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 02650b9313e22039ce066000d6ededcc4041156e.



Reason for revert: some search engine is missing an image, which

is triggering a CHECK. See https://crbug.com/1517107



Original change's description:

> [Waffle] Support for high DPI icons

>

> Old behavior on desktop:

> - google used 24px icon, possibly upscaled for HiDPI (very blurry)

> - other search engines used 96px downscaled (slightly blurry)

>

> Old behavior on iOS:

> - all icons were downscaled from 96px

>

> New behavior on choice screen:

> All engines use 24px on low DPI and 48px on high DPI on desktop.

> iOS uses 48px or 72px depending on the screen.

> Icons are no longer scaled.

>

> In desktop settings:

> icons are downscaled from 48px to 16px or 32px (depending on screen dpi).

>

> Choice screens, zoomed-in comparison:

> https://screenshot.googleplex.com/3hCE9kjfxpY8Qya

>

> Settings, zoomed-in comparison:

> https://screenshot.googleplex.com/4xZ9cux98DjCHa4

> Uses 48px downscaled to 16 or 32, `image-set` not supported.

>

> iOS screenshots

> * iPhone 15 pro simulator https://screenshot.googleplex.com/3vCxcaHpSCBfxQR

>

> * iPhone SE simulator

entry.title: [Site search policy] Fix featured/non-featured disambiguation
entry.content:
The current implementation was triggering a CHECK when we tried to do

a "@work" search in the omnibox for a site search engine set by the

SiteSearchSettings policy.



The problem was that `SearchHostToURLsMap::GetTemplateURLForHost` [1]

tried to disambiguate between "work" and "@work" when "work" is the

keyword for a featured site search, and the status quo implementation

assumed that `TemplateURL::IsEnterpriseSideSearchEngineBetterThanEngine`

was only called for search engines with the same keyword - which is

not true if two search engines share the same host URL but not the same

keyword.



The proposed solution fixes the issue by calling

`IsEnterpriseSideSearchEngineBetterThanEngine` only if we are sure that

one engine was set by SSP policy and the other was not. When both engines

are set by the policy, it will prefer the one that is marked as featured.

Otherwise, fallback to the existing comparison using other signals.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/search_engines/search_host_to_urls_map.cc;l=56;drc=8ba1bad80dc22235693a0dd41fe55c0fd2dbdabd



Fixed: b/318549754

Bug: b/318549754



Change-Id: I71d5c11b4fcbc9c6054d5a2638d6be390b93a6b3

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5165468

Reviewed-by: Angela Yoeurng

entry.title: [AF] Set PopupType and FillingProduct in AutofillPopup pixel tests.
entry.content:
PopupViewViewsBrowsertestBase set the list of suggestions to the

AutofillPopupController, but don't set neither PopupType nor the

main FillingProduct. As a result, AutofillPopupController::GetPopupType

returns 0, which is PopupType::kAddresses.



This CL mocks both the PopupType and main FillingProduct. Main

FillingProduct is computed from the first suggestion in the list.

PopupType is passes as a parameter to the function. It will be removed

in the next CL, which removes usages of the PopupType in the

popup_row_factory_utils and popup_cell_utils.

entry.title: ui_controls: For drag-ending LMB release, post task after dispatch
entry.content:
By default, UIControlsOzone::SendEventToSink posts the closure before

dispatching the event. This is because during the dispatch, execution

may enter a nested message loop. That being said, most events don't

enter a nested message loop. This commit introduces the option to post

the closure after dispatching the event, which can be safely used if it

is known that the dispatch will not enter a nested message loop. This

provides finer-grained control over the ordering of outbound Wayland

messages. For example, this option allows us to send zcr_ui_controls::

request_processed after wl_data_source::dnd_finished when a drag session

is ended by a left-mouse-button release event. Without this option, Exo

always sends request_processed before dnd_finished, which results in

non-deterministic behavior in Lacros interactive_ui_tests.



Change-Id: Ibb2e11ffb04fdf2b1212cbf4a76bdaf7badc299c

SharedImageManager::ProduceDawn() for non-OpenGLES backend_type.

entry.title: Add a ScriptWrappable::ToV8(ScriptState*)
entry.content:
This is a move of ToV8HelperScriptWrappable() from to_v8_traits.h.

This has two advantages:

* A caller that needs to convert a ScriptWrappable to a v8::Value and

knows that its ScriptWrappable is non-null now has access to a much

clearer and shorter conversion method.

* ScriptWrappable::Wrap() can now be protected instead of public



Two of the other common wrappable base classes (DictionaryBase and

UnionBase) have existing `ToV8Value()` methods. Rename them to

`ToV8()` for consistency.

whenever results were fetched. This CL updates this to request the

updates whenever `body` changes height. This is useful for animations

as the height of `body` can change after result is fetched.

scrollable when it is not if the user scrolled during a previous result.

entry.title: Fixed optional toolbar button not updating icon tint correctly
entry.content:
Some buttons on OptionalButtonView supports tinting while others don't, this is currently handled by ToolbarPhone which adds or removes the button's tint based on the currently shown button.



This works for most cases, except when running an animation swapping between tinted and untinted colors (or viceversa). It would result in the user profile picture appearing as a black circle while dissapearing, or other icons showing up with incorrect colors.



This CL moves this logic to OptionalToolbarButton so we can correctly set each button's tint during the animations.

entry.title: Simplify and document Cronet API version plumbing
entry.content:
This reverts "Split Cronet's implementation and interface API

versioning" (commit c35074a30121a3d8a2fbc4ec7db7b6f7815bb972), which was

based on a misunderstanding of how Google Play Services API version

compatibility checks work. The Google Play Services Client SDK code will

always accept a Cronet API impl level that is at least

ApiVersion.MIN_COMPATIBLE_API_LEVEL, which is already a separate

constant from the "current" API level. There is no need for any other

constants.

entry.title: [iOS] Add c++ observer for url loading
entry.content:
This CL adds a c++ observer class to observer URL loading. The class

added will be used in a subsequent CL.



To bring parity with other observer classes that have both C++ and Obj-C

implementations, the existing UrlLoadingObserver protocol is renamed to

`UrlLoadingObserving` so the postfix `Observer` would be left for the

C++ implementation.



The method signatures have also been updated so `const GURL&` replaces

GURL. This follows the best practise of go/totw/109 and also makes

testing with OCMock easier.

entry.title: PinnedState: Control pinned state from Ash asynchronously
entry.content:
This CL lets Lacros update kWindowPinTypeKey value when the pinned state

is acknowledged by Ash instead of immediately update it on PinWindow

call.



In the current implementation, it triggers ProcessFullscreen once when

Lacros intends to enter pinned mode by setting kWindowPinTypeKey to

pinned while actual pin behavior is triggered through

PinnedModeExtension::Pin which works asynchronously. This causes Lacros

to enter immersive/fullscreen state randomly before pinned state.



With this change, kWindowStateTypeKey is updated on receiving pinned

state configure event.



Bug: 1511187, 1508249

entry.title: media/gpu/V4L2StatefulVD: Fix recycling resources from ImageProcessor
entry.content:
In some configurations (MT8173 eg Hana) VideoDecoder is used to feed an

ImageProcessor: the VideoDecoder's |CAPTURE_queue_| feeds the

ImageProcessor's OUTPUT queue. VD |CAPTURE_queue_| is managed using a

V4L2Queue. Buffers in a V4L2Queue can be in one of three states:

enqueued (hence ready to be decoded onto), in flight (i.e. in use by

some consumer), and free.



ToT transitions free-->enqueued in TryAndEnqueueCAPTUREQueueBuffers();

however in some cases, the queues are at capacity (|OUTPUT_queue_| full,

|CAPTURE_queue_| empty), preventing calling that method in the regular

ways. This erroneous behaviour became evident in a recently landed Seek

Tast test case: sometimes the Seek landed in e.g. second 19 of the 20s

sequence, causing Chrome to try to decode very fast (*), which fills

up both VD and the IP queues; since ToT has no way to recycle the

pictures explicitly upon resource releasing, it ended up in deadlock.



The solution is of course to try and reenqueue explicitly upon resource

being released. This needs a WeakPtr, which causes a rename.



(*) A

entry.title: Webgl2 conformance expectation clipping failure for all intel chromeos
entry.content:
Intel seems to have a slightly different implementation of the line

primitive than the webgl reference (or likely most other gpus). Line

primitives are not a well defined consistent feature of the API so we

will just silence these failures.



More details on the difference:



Rounding to nearest pixel occurs for the line primitive in the

vertical and horizontal. The rounding in the horizontal is the same

but the rounding in the vertical seems inverted. This results in a

disagreement by half a pixel. So if a line goes to 126.5+ the intel

implementation will fill pixel 127 whereas the webgl reference

requires the line to goto 127.0+ to fill this pixel.

entry.title: [ios] Fix issue with width of feed header when feed is turned off
entry.content:
When the feed is turned off, FeedWrapperVC creates an empty collection

view to contain the NTP which is similar to the collection view that the

feed creates. But this empty collection view isn't exactly the same and

constraints need to be adjusted to ensure the feed header's width is

correct, and that it is still possible to scroll vertically when

touching the horizontal margins of the NTP.



This change constrains the width of the feed header to match the new

moduleLayoutGuide. In order for this to work, the margins inside the

feed header had to be removed when FeedContainment is turned off so that

the edges line up with the feed itself. When FeedContainment is on,

those internal margins are necessary to inset it from edge of the

containment module.

entry.title: Fix policy component's PRESUBMIT to handle policy removal
entry.content:
Policy component's PRESUBMIT check makes it impossible to remove support

for a policy.



From

https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/enterprise/add_new_policy.md#removing-support-for-a-policy

- removing support for a policy involves updating the policy's YAML

file and removing its test from policy/test/data/pref_mapping. But a

PRESUBMIT checks for policy YAML file modifications that do not have an

equivalent test.



Modify the PRESUBMIT check to skip checking missing tests for

unsupported policies.



Additionally fix some formatting and grammatical errors.

entry.title: [A11y] Break infinite loop between IsMissingParent() and ToString()
entry.content:
Currently, IsMissingParent() can throw a DUMP_WILL_BE_CHECK(), which

calls ToString(), which calls back into IsMissingParent(), ad

infinitum.



This breaks the infinite loop by copying the simple logic for detecting

a missing parent into ToString(). It keeps the valuable frozen checks

within IsMissingParent().



Note: we will still need to address the root cause of bug 1515900,

because although this breaks the infinite loop, the original

DUMP_WILL_BE_CHECK in IsMissingParent() will still occur.



Fixed: 1515900

entry.title: Attach libaom threads to the Chrome threading system.
entry.content:
This change adds an adaption to the libaom threading

abstraction that makes libaom's threads to

use Chrome threads, for example enabling perfetto to

get insight, and gain control over thread QoS.



The previous thread abstraction made for libvpx was

templatized to reduce code duplication.

entry.title: Remove DCHECK on vulkan instance extensions
entry.content:
Chromeos does not use the traditional vk swapchain because it uses DRM

(or wayland). There are very few supported instance extensions so in

the case of the eve platform we can return empty for the call to

'QueryVkInstanceExtensionsFromANGLE'.



Empty is not an error. If we want to detect an error here we will have

to switch over to wrapping with optional.



Bug: b/317209177

entry.title: Make the lack of server type explicit in debug surfaces
entry.content:
Our debug surfaces, chrome://autofill-internals and

chrome://flags/#show-autofill-type-predictions are not very explicit

about the situation that Autofill may not have received server

predictions, yet.



chrome://autofill-internals shows an empty list [] and the

autofill-information attribute says "server type: NO_SERVER_DATA" which

is indistinguishable from the server responding NO_SERVER_DATA (meaning

"I don't have a classification").



This CL makes both cases cleaner.



There is an aspect of the CL that may be controversial:

I only reserved field type 161 but did not expose it as a new enum

value. The reason is that I won't want to cause confusion within the

Chrome source code. It's sufficient to treat the absence of a server

classification as NO_SERVER_DATA in most locations.

The choice comes with the disadvantage that we have a string literal

in form_cache.cc instead of FieldTypeToStringView. It's a trade-off...



NO_IFTTT=The new field type is not exposed to devtools. We keep showing NO_SERVER_DATA.



Bug: 1516961

Change-Id: I02545685f104d00d850e362254b7f2e0a76918df

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5181354

Commit-Queue: Dominic Battre

Reviewed-by: Norge Vizcay

Auto-Submit: Dominic Battre

Reviewed-by: Arthur Sonzogni

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1245281}

entry.title: [Passwords] Support fetching multiple avatars
entry.content:
This CL adds proper support for fetching multiple avatars for the

touch-to-fill surface.



To avoid blocking the UI thread, it moves away from using

CyclicBarrier and uses start a task on another thread pool to fetch

all and aggregate all images.



Bug: 1504098

Change-Id: I0d45f93d572a5c6fcb6f77e2ea8f905bb39f4444

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5177003

entry.title: Reland "Write did-run to registry asynchronously."
entry.content:
In this attempt, only run asynchronously from the renderer launch, not

from the DLL loading, since the thread pool does not exist during

DLL loading.



This is a reland of commit 74344b22ad439a57f6f99453c83b9b9ed59813d8

Patchset 1 is the original change.



Original change's description:

> Write did-run to registry asynchronously.

>

> My understanding is that generally we allow registry writes on the main

> sequence. However, they can take time if some other application is

> calling RegFlushKey (which blocks modifications to the entire hive), or

> something else is affecting registry write performance on the machines.

>

> Since neither the sequencing nor outcome of recording did-run is

> relevant to the callers, making the operation non-blocking seems easy

> enough.

>

> Fixed: 1509160

> Change-Id: I3d760bbe13c2b6427705c02524441c1ea0ce87b1

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5164608

> Auto-Submit: Joshua Pawlicki

entry.title: Do not remove File kind objects in dataTransfer.clearData().
entry.content:
As per the spec

https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/dnd.html#dom-datatransfer-cleardata,

clearData() does not delete the File objects.

This aligns the behavior of clearData() with other browsers such as

Firefox and Safari.



PSA: https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/zFvrMpt8hyw/m/HW_0woNzAAAJ



Bug: 1402130

entry.title: [Passwords] Do not send crowdsourcing votes for forms on localhost
entry.content:
Crowdsourcing helps to classify forms online, based on signals from

different users about the same form. However on localhost it's likely

that semantically different forms will receive same signatures, so

PasswordManager should not upload votes for such forms.



The CL disables vote uploading by not creating the VotesUploader

object in the form manager when it's not needed.



Bug: 1515560

Change-Id: Ie3faaccba13fd15e757490982b39f0a92c1a6a7d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5177655

Commit-Queue: Maria Kazinova

Reviewed-by: Vasilii Sukhanov

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1245249}

entry.title: Reland "[iOS] Promo to upload bookmarks should be limited to left-behind ones"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit c8123bec897b539a37b49f8fe29376594c8b089d

Rebased on top of the fix in crrev.com/c/5176917.

No changes were made to this CL.



Original change's description:

> [iOS] Promo to upload bookmarks should be limited to left-behind ones

>

> The batch upload promo from bookmarks manager should not be shown if the

> user has already uploaded the sync-left behind bookmarks.

> This should be the solution to avoid the confusion that happens because

> both local and sync left-behind bookmarks are in the local store.

>

> To guarantee that the promo should never be shown after the user

> chooses to upload these bookmarks, this CL introduces a pref for that,

> and writes/reads to it.

>

> Note: the left-behind bookmarks in this usage are: all the bookmarks

> that exist in the local store, where the current account is the last syncing account, till the user uploads them using this promo.

>

> Fixed: 1513110

> Change-Id: Id5fef0ed0d0a88f42401e3c7ad7a3699dcff63c7

entry.title: [Passwords] Don't query driver upon page navigation
entry.content:
PasswordManagerDriver life time is bound to the render frame host.

Upon navigation, render frame host is destroyed as well as the

PasswordManagerDriver.



After https://crrev.com/c/5132832, driver_->GetLastCommittedURL() is

invoked during the clean-up phase which is usually triggered upon

user interacting with the touch to fill surface.

If the clean-up is invoked upon page navigation, the driver will be

destroyed before the touch to fill UI is dismissed.



This CL is avoiding a crash by returning an empty URL in such case.



Fixed: 1516275

Change-Id: If7645d678446cef2ce44df05307924983067018e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5177652

entry.title: Release DataPipe when ScriptStreamer has done its work.
entry.content:
The streamer parent object lifetime is managed by cppgc. It will be

deleted when GC decides to. This can take a while in some cases.

As things are now this will keep the consumer end of mojo DataPipe

alive for longer periods of time which can lead to problems like the

VA exhaustion described in crbug.com/1510906. From what I can tell

nothing should really use the data pipe after

ScriptStreamer::SetFinished gets invoked. I think we may as well

explicitly release the data pipe at this point. This should release

the DataPipe buffer which might consume non trivial amount of VA

compared to the actual size of the mapped physical memory.



Bug: 1510906

Change-Id: Ibfe30ee2a79dcb209644d048879caa434991eb3a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5116181

entry.title: [bookmarks] Implement creation and removal of account permanent folders
entry.content:
This patch adds basic implementation for two recently-introduced

BookmarkModel APIs, namely CreateAccountPermanentFolders() and

RemoveAccountPermanentFolders(). Both are meant to be used from sync

code, to be tackled in follow-up patches.



Dealing with UUIDs is not properly supported in this very first version.

These account folders should ideally use the same UUIDs as the

equivalent local-or-syncable ones, but the UUID index doesn't currently

allow to do so without running into DCHECK failures (UUIDs are expected

to be unique within a BookmarkModel instance). TODOs have been added

to improve this support in follow-up patches.



Design doc (sorry, Googlers only):

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1i9XuP0lXOvEbvlwXre-EXMum4dxs_UToCsCcImIPEQU/edit?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-1t7DIB0kTwaaGMmxtiZLqw

entry.title: [quic connection migration] Run mid-migration callback for migration probing
entry.content:
QuicConnectionMigrationTest.ConnectionCloseDuringMigration requires

that MidMigrationCallbackForTesting() to be called during a

connection migration. However, In a case where a network made default

signal comes first and probing succeeds, the callback was not called since a migration succeeds without calling Migrate():

QuicChromiumClientSession::TryMigrateBackToDefaultNetwork()

-> MaybeStartProbing()

-> StartProbing()

-> FinishStartProbing()

-> ValidatePath() with a ConnectionMigrationValidationResultDelegate

-> OnConnectionMigrationProbeSucceeded()

-> MigrateToSocket()



This CL modifies StartProbing() to call the callback to satisfy the

test requirement. This should fix the flakiness of the test.

entry.title: [b4p/android] Do not defer Gaia cookie wiping on "clear browsing data"
entry.content:
The "clear browsing data" dialog has options to clear both cookies and

passwords. Clearing passwords while passwords-account-storage is

enabled should upload the deletions (or at least that's the current

questionable behavior). However, clearing the Gaia cookie immediately

disables passwords-account-storage on Desktop and prevents the upload.

So https://crbug.com/1086433 added logic to defer wiping of the Gaia

cookie.



This logic does not apply to Android, where the identity model

isn't based on cookies, so it's now #ifdef-ed out. In the desktop

code path, the check for the kEnablePasswordsAccountStorage flag is

removed, since the flag is long launched on that platform. In fact

that's one of the minor inspirations for this CL: checks for the

flag might need to be replaced with something else; now there's one

less check.



Bug: 1509058

Change-Id: I7e10d60e913fb5c5fbce6b6a0a8c0b75697cad1d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5182154

entry.title: [sharing] Decouple SharingTargetDeviceInfo from syncer::DeviceInfo
entry.content:
No behavioral changes, refactoring that should lead to the same behavior

in practice.



Follow-up patch to https://crrev.com/c/5173408, where the alias to

syncer::DeviceInfo is replaced with an actual class that contains the

pieces that are relevant for sharing API callers. This mimics the

approach used by send_tab_to_self::TargetDeviceInfo() which has very

similar needs.



The change also allows removing syncer::DeviceInfo::Clone(), which is

generally prone to abuse and potential performance regressions.

entry.title: Unify checks for Gaia URL in SyncCredentialsFilter
entry.content:
What this class wishes to enforce is "don't save the user's Gaia account

password in that same account". Imagine there is a subdomain.google.com

which does not integrate with Gaia auth, but rather allows one to choose

any (username, password) tuple. In this highly unrealistic scenario, the

user might choose (mygaiaaccount@gmail.com, notmygaiapassword) as their

credentials and SyncCredentialsFilter should allow saving those.



This CL fixes that behavior on Android (kEnablePasswordsAccountStorage

is only disabled in that platform). In practice, this scenario is quite

unrealistic and the main motivation is actually to simplify the code.



Bug: 1499837

Change-Id: I0a63e7b72fe77ff6f7eaaa6fd42f44c66bdabb65
